definition: topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: The rain flowed into the low-lying land.
sentences.chinese: 雨水都順着山勢流到了塘坳裏。

sentences.english: It was a steep climb, so we rested for a while halfway up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 因山勢高峻，乃在山腰休息片時。

sentences.english: The severity of mountainous terrain becomes clearer as you start climbing.
sentences.chinese: 努力攀登，視野中的險峻山勢就會越來越清晰。

sentences.english: twists and turns along the hill-tops of mountain chains in northern China.
sentences.chinese: 長城像鏈條一樣隨着山勢的走向在中國北方蜿蜒曲折。

sentences.english: Hill of Yang 's two, steep mountains, of great momentum.
sentences.chinese: 山之陽的兩路，山勢陡峭，氣勢磅礴。

sentences.english: Raised terraces for communal usage combined with covered car parking are blended into the slops .
sentences.chinese: 升起的臺地與停車場結合，使之融入到地形山勢之中。

sentences.english: Shan Yin Road Northwest, gentle mountains, valley deep valley long.
sentences.chinese: 山之陰的西北路，山勢平緩，谷深峪長。

sentences.english: Cape Mount towering mountains, rolling, is a natural barrier Shanhaiguan.
sentences.chinese: 角山山勢巍峨，綿延起伏，是山海關的天然屏障。

sentences.english: The main peak of the Jinfo Mountain is 2251 meters high, precipitous and spectacular .
sentences.chinese: 金佛山主峯高2251米，山勢陡峭，氣象萬千。

definition: sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
